string.text: I've come to see you.
Very well.
I have done what you asked.
I could not complete your quest.
Very well.
I'm not ready.
And this one...
I'll buy it.
Ok, I'll take it.
Here you go.
Hand over your weapons and tell me where you stashed your gear and I might let you live.
Okay, okay! Just don't kill me!
Whatever you say, just let me live!
Here, take it. Hope you burn in hell, motherfucker.
Have mercy on me!
Take whatever you want! Just please let me live!
Oh god, please don't kill me!
Take it. Now go, let me die in peace.
Fuck you!
I'll do whatever you say, please don't kill me!
Take them. Now please let me go.
Here's a medkit. Now get out of my sight.
Time to end you.
Thanks for rescuing me. I thought I was done for.
Come on, let's get out of here.
Return with the prisoner to claim your reward.
I want to change factions.
I'll do it.
See me when it's done.
Okay.
I'm ready to join your facton.
I no longer wish to join your faction.
You've changed your mind?
Yes, I want to remain with my current faction.
Suit yourself.
You have joined the %s faction.
You couldn't complete the %s task?
I got him! I killed %s! The reward is ours!
Well that's the end of %s. Let's go collect that bounty.
He's dead! That was him! That was %s! We got him!
Looks like I'll be the one collecting the bounty on %s.
Well boys, you can all stop looking for %s. I put an end to him.
If anyone else was looking for %s, you're too late. I got to him first.
Repair %s to at least %s% condition
I'm looking for someone.
Aren't we all.
Yeah? And who might that be?
Who are you looking for?
Not sure if I can help you, I don't know too many other stalkers.
Anyone in particular?
What's his name? I might know him.
I'm looking for %s called %s. Do you know him?
Have you seen %s by the name of %s?
I need to find %s known as %s. Ever heard of him?
Do you happen to know %s called %s?
Sorry, never heard of him.
No friend of mine.
Haven't seen that asshole in ages. Punch him in the face for me if you find him.
No idea, sorry.
I've heard of him, no idea where he might be though.
That guy? I heard he drowned in the Oasis.
I know he's a son of a bitch, but that's about it.
You're looking for him too, huh? I haven't had any luck finding him either.
If you want to talk to him you better find him before I do. Next time I see him he's dead.
He's probably home fucking your sister.
Yes, I saw him near here not too long ago. I'll mark his location on your map.
Yeah, he's not far from here. I'll show you on your map.
You're in luck, I just saw him. I'll mark his location on your map.
Haven't seen him recently. He usually hangs out in %s.
I saw him up in %s not too long ago.
Yeah, I've heard of him. You can probably find him in %s.
I know him, not sure where he is now though. Try asking around in %s.
Last time I saw that guy was when I was in %s. Might want to try asking there.
Try checking around in %s, he's usually in that area.
I need your help finding something.
What is it you're looking for?
Sure, I'll help. What are we looking for?
I might be able to help.
Ok, I'll help. What are you trying to find?
What is it?
Ok, but I don't work cheap. What's the job?
Sorry, I can't help you.
Can't you see I'm busy, stalker? Go away.
I can't find my ass with both hands, what are you asking me for?
Sorry, I'm not looking for any work right now.
Not interested.
Sorry buddy, I've got my own problems.
I've been looking for a %s. Will you help me find it?
I'm having trouble locating a %s. Can you help me look?
I need to find a %s. Want to help me look for it?
I'm trying to find a %s but I need another set of eyes.
I'll help you find it if you're willing to pay me for the trouble. %s RU should cover it.
I'm sure I can find it for you, but it will cost you %s RU if you want my help.
Ok, I'll do it. My fee is %s RU, and I need it up front.
Sure, I'll help you out. Give me say... %s RU and I'll come along with you.
Sounds important. I bet someone's willing to pay pretty good for something like that. Tell you what, give me a cut and I'll help you find it. I'm sure %s RU isn't asking too much for my services.
I don't have enough money.
Okay. Follow me, I'll lead you to the area.
It's a deal. Follow me.
Fair enough. Come with me.
Sounds good. Let's get moving.
Well, my work is done. Take care, stalker.
Glad I could be of help. Good luck to you stalker.
Ok, I held up my end of the bargain. See you around, stalker.
This is the place? Ok, I'll start looking for the %s.
I'll let you know if I see the %s your're looking for.
I'll find your %s. Shouldn't take me too long.
You want me to find a %s in this mess? I should have charged you double.
I think I see it. I'll mark the location of the %s on your map.
I think I know where the %s is. I've marked the location on your map.
I see the %s. I'll send the coordinates to your PDA.
I found the %s. I'll show you where it is on your map.
That case you're carrying looks heavy. You must be tired of hauling it around.
I need to return it to it's rightful owner.

Rightful owner? Shit man, this is the Zone, everything's up for grabs. You're lucky you met me, I'm a master safecracker. I'll have that case open in no time and we can split the contents, what do you say?
Alright, crack it open.
No thanks.

Let's see, simple enough lock... just need to... ah! There we go, it's open. Ok, so let's split this up. I've already seen what's in here so this is what we'll do to make it fair; there are %s items in here, I'll take them out one at a time, you tell me if you want it or not. If you want it, it's yours. If you don't, it's mine. We'll do that until we each have %s items, ok?
Fair enough. Let's get started.
I'll take that.
You keep it.
Alright, the first item is a %s. Do you want it?
Ok, next is a %s. Your's or mine?
Fine by me. Next we have a %s.
Here's a %s. Want it?
Almost at the end. Do you want this %s?
Ok, you have your %s, the rest is mine. Thanks, stalker.
Alright, that's %s for me. The rest is yours. Pleasure doing business with you.

I've got bad news for you stalker, you're a wanted man for the killing of %s. There's a bounty on your head and an expert assassin is looking to bring you in, dead or alive. I'd lay low for a while if I were you.
Your attempted assassin has been killed.
What do you know about the man who wants me dead?
I know it's gonna be me in a minute if you don't stop breathing down my neck.
I assume he wants you to live no more.
From what I've heard he's one of the best. I'd hate to be you right now.
Sorry stalker, I've got my own problems.
He's a monster. Even the Monolith run away from him. I feel bad for you buddy, wish I could help.
I don't even know who you are.
I hear he's a lunatic. He likes to eat your ears before he kills you. Real sick shit.
If it's who I think it is you better find a good place to hide out for a while. He's the best shot in the Zone.
You're never going to see him coming. They say he learned how to become invisible by beating a Bloodsucker until it showed him how to do it.
Why don't you back up about 50 meters and ask me again. I don't want anyone missing you and hitting me.
Word is some guy has been asking around about you in %s.
I don't know, but I do know there's a renowned assassin that's traveling through %s right now.
Someone asked me if I knew who you were while I was in %s, might be the guy you're looking for.
I heard he's in %s, but if he's looking for you he probably won't be there long.
He's probably made it to %s by now if he's tracking you here.
I know that from where he was dispatched from, he would have to be traveling through %s if he's on his way here.
There was a guy here asking around about you earlier. I'll show you where he went.
I heard there was someone looking for you not too long ago. I'll mark his location on your map.
Not sure if it's your guy, but word is there's a master assassin stalking the area. I'll show you where he was spotted on your map.
Hey {actor_name}, better watch out, there's a guy %s that has been asking around about you.
Does anyone know a stalker called {actor_name}? Some guy %s is looking for him.
There's a bounty hunter %s looking for {actor_name}. I'd hate to be him right now.
Some guy %s was just asking about {actor_name}. Anyone know where he is?
{actor_name}, do you know there's a bounty on your head? There's an assassin looking for you %s.
I heard there's a master assassin %s looking for {actor_name}. Glad he's not looking for me.

Has anyone told you about the Oasis yet? Well, then listen to me stalker. Legend tells of a magical area hidden deep within the Zone, the only place in Chernobyl where you can find clear water, free from radiation. The Zone has imparted these waters with the ability rejuvenate a stalker, healing all wounds and ailments, even removing radiation poisoning from the body. But there is even more to it than that. The waters are rumored to also have brought into existence a very special artefact, one so unique and powerful that men would be willing to pay great riches to obtain it. Many have spoken about the Oasis, some even claim to have seen it, but so far, no one has ever found it. Maybe it is just a legend, but with all of the wonders I have seen here in the Zone I would not be surprised if it was true. If the Oasis really does exist, and if it does contain it's legendary artefact, whoever should find it first could become a very rich man.
I've heard you know how to get to the top of the Southern Plateau.
Heard that, did ya? Yeah, I've been up there. Not sure why everyone's so interested in it, ain't nothing up there but a crashed helicopter and a bunch of goddamn mutants.
I need to investigate the wreckage. Can you tell me how to get to it?
There's no time! The mutant Wave is coming and will destroy us all if we're not prepared!
Yes, they told me you were crazy. I can help you. Tell me how to get to the top and I'll help you battle the demons in your head.

Demons ain't the problem, it's the damned mutants! Ain't you been listening to me? When the Wave hits, idiots like you are gonna be the first to go. Get the hell off my ark before I feed you to my dog!
I've got a shotgun too, buddy. Tell me how to get to the crash site or we can test who has the quicker draw.

Haha! You mister tough-guy? Listen pal, you won't feel so tough when the mutant Wave washes over us and destroys everything within the Zone! The ark will be the only refuge, remember that if you want to live! In the meantime, get the fuck out of here before I sick Lassie on you.
Then we must eliminate the mutants before it is too late. Show me the way to the top of the Plateau, I will exterminate the mutants that have been hiding up there.

Well, you ain't so dumb after all... alright, I'll tell ya'. If you are a fool, you can head directly toward it and try to climb it, and you will soon discover why I am the only one who has been up there. If you want to know how I did it, you will go north instead. Go to the Burnt Village and enter it from the road to the southwest. As soon as you enter the village there will be a field enclosed by a wooden fence on your right. Cross the field and you will find an opening in the fence on the other side; if you can see the Skadovsk in the distance you are going the right way. But be careful, the entire area is alive with fire. One wrong move and you will be burned alive. When you reach the opening in the fence you will be at the edge of a cliff. Close your eyes and envision yourself on top of the plateau. Believe that you are there, remove any thought that it is impossible. Once your mind is ready, throw yourself into the void. When you open your eyes you will be on the plateau, the Zone will have taken you there.
So you're telling me to run through an inferno and then jump off a cliff? If you didn't want to help me you could have just said so.

Hey man, if you don't believe me, don't do it. Here, take this artefact, it will help protect you from the heat in the field. Just promise me once you make it to the top you will wipe out every last one of those freaking mutants up there!
Enough of this nonsense. I'll pay you if you can tell me how to get to the top of the plateau.
Fine, give to me money.
Here, now tell me what you know.
I have no idea what you're talking about.
Be careful if you're traveling %s of here. There has been a lot of mutant activity reported in the area.
I heard some strange noises coming from the %s. I'm staying the hell away from there for a while.
There's word of mutant activity to the %s of here. Be careful if you're going that way.
There have been reports of %s %s of here. You might want to stay away from that area.
I spotted some %s to the %s not too long ago. Hope they're not heading this way.
Some %s have been sighted %s of here. Watch yourself if you're planning on heading that way.
Gonta
River Guide
Gonta
River Guide
I'm looking for transport.
Sorry buddy, some asshole stole my boat.
You want to go north? I have a boat I managed to get running not far from here, I can take you up river to the Outskirts if you like... for a fee. %s RU should cover it.
I have a small boat stashed away in the reeds over there. If you're willing to pay me %s RU, I'll take you down to the Truck Cemetery.
Ok. Let's go.
I don't have enough money.
What happened here?

I'm the pilot of a helicopter that crashed into the Jupiter Plant. There were several of us, we were the front end of a mission called "Operation Fairway". All of our helicopters experienced simultaneous failures and either crashed or had to perform an emergency landing. The few of us that survived gathered at this rendezvous point while we waited to be rescued. The Monolith cultists found us within a few days and overran the tunnel, taking us all hostage and using us as bait with the intent to slaughter the rescue teams when they arrived. When help didn't come, they started killing us off one by one. I was the last one left. They would have killed me too if you hadn't shown up when you did.
Tell me about Operation Fairway.

I was part of a 5-ship flight in the operation, callsign "Stingray". We were to be the leading edge of a massive assault on the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant. You see stalker, the situation at the center of the Zone is far more dire than anyone knows, including many people in the Military. The truth is, the Military has lost control of the Zone to a formidable and well-entrenched enemy. The Monolith are more than just a fringe cult, they are a full-out army that is well armed and far larger in number than anyone had ever guessed. They completely occupy the NPP and grow more powerful with each day. Operation Fairway was intended to eliminate the Monolith force and regain control of the heart of the Zone. Now that it has failed, I fear there is nothing left to stop the onslaught of the Monolith army.
Can you tell me about the helicopters?
Which one do you want to know about?
Tell me what happened to Stingray 1.

One of the guys on their flight said he could feel the chopper take a hit and then smelled something burning; the engine had caught fire. The pilots managed to get to the helipads near the Jupiter Plant but they were both killed on impact. They lost a few more guys when it turned out that the approach to the helipads was full of landmines.
Tell me what happened to Stingray 2.
We lost comms with them right before our flight went down. Some of the men reported seeing them crash into the towers at the Iron Forest substation and burst into flames. There were no survivors.
Tell me what happened to Stingray 3.

The pilot told me he suddenly lost both engines and they had to set down on top of the Southern Plateau in Zaton. They were lucky in that they had a soft landing, but they were attacked by a pack of snorks and lost a few men. The others decided not to stick around - they contacted the survivors from Stingray 5 and went to meet up with them.
Tell me what happened to Stingray 4.

That was my flight. I had a bad feeling about the whole thing. We were enroute to the IP, the equipment was fine, and then a second later we were flying in a piece of scrap metal with all the electronics disabled. Me and the copilot tried to reach flat ground but the controls were totally unresponsive. We fell straight through the the roof of the main workshop of the Jupiter plant. I was the only one who made it out alive. I got some help from a couple scientists that have a bunker nearby. They patched me up, and then I made my way over here to link up with the other survivors and wait for the extraction team.
Tell me what happened to Stingray 5.

The electronics malfunctioned and they dropped straight into a swamp in Zaton. A few of the men survived the crash. They linked up with the survivors from Stingray 3 at a nearby barge. It was reported to me that the man who lived there was crazy as a loon; when the men tried to detain him, he tried to detain them! They made their way over here to the designated extraction point, the place we were supposed to be rescued from in the event of total mission failure, which this ultimately was. But help never came, at least not until you got here.
What caused the failure of the mission?

That's the scariest thing, man. We were flying along just fine, no issues, should have been a short flight to the LZ near the power plant. One of the guys on my flight had an anomaly detector on him - all of a sudden the thing starts going crazy, and then I lost all control of the aircraft. The crews from the other flights reported the same thing, we all simultaneously flew into an anomaly. What do you think the odds are of that happening, each of us hitting a separate anomaly at the same exact time? And look up; when was the last time you saw an anomaly form in the middle of the sky? It's like the Zone itself knew we were coming, and it swatted us down like flies.
That's all I needed to know. Come with me, I'll take you back to Agroprom and you can link back up with the Military.

Are you kidding me? There's no way I'm going back to the Military. They sent us on a suicide mission and then couldn't bail us out when it went to shit! I've spent days as a prisoner, watching my comrades be executed one after another, wondering when it would be my turn. I've had enough of the Zone, I want to get as far away from it as possible.
You're deserting?

I can't continue to put my life on the line for this cause. This war is unwinnable, the Monolith are unstoppable monsters that will never be defeated. I've heard there is a stalker in the Pripyat Outskirts that has a boat. I'm going to find him and steal his boat and sail as far away from here as it will take me. Please don't try to stop me. The Zone has broken me, I can't take this place anymore. I just want to leave.
Go. Good luck to you.
You're coming with me. I need you to corroborate your story.
PDA
An encrypted PDA. You have been promised a reward for its return.
Pilot's PDA
A PDA found at the Jupiter Plant crash site. The map shows the location of a rally point, perhaps the survivors may be gathered there.
ID Card
An ID card, presumably containing information about it's former owner.
Code Card

Excellent, Colleague. I'm glad that you've received 2nd level access. At last you will find out what goes on in our laboratory. Your access code is 1243. Chief of Laboratory X-18, Piotr Ilyitch Kalugin.
Code Card

Dear colleague, may I remind you that starting tomorrow you will attend to the container in the central laboratory room. You must inspect the containers every two hours. Report everything directly to me. The code to the central laboratory room is 9524. Chief of Laboratory X-18, Piotr Ilyitch Kalugin.
Access Card
An access card for an electronic lock.
Documents
Important papers. Return them for your reward.
Flight Plan
The tattered remains of a pilot's flight plan found next to a crashed helicopter.
Notebook
A weatherproof journal containing research data.
Document Case
These documents look important. They could be worth money to the right buyer.
Plateau Case
A case found in a cave on the top of the Southern Plateau.
Locked Case
A locked case. Not sure what's inside but it's heavy. Better be worth it lugging this thing around.
Anomalous Plant
A strange plant that was found growing near an anomaly.
Black Box
The flight data recorder recovered from a crashed helicopter.
UAV Memory Module
The memory module from the crashed spy drone.
Data Module
The data module from a crashed helicopter.
Transistors
A box of transistors.
Capacitors
A bank of high-voltage capacitors.
Wire
A spool of nichrome wire.
Circuit Boards
Some basic electronic circuit boards. They are in remarkably good condition for the Zone, they may still be useable.
Gunsmith Toolkit
A set of basic gunsmith tools.
Technician Toolkit
A decent set of specialized tools. Some of the gunsmiths in the Zone would certainly be willing to pay for these.
Armorer's Toolkit
A complete set of military grade armorer's tools. In the proper hands, these tools could be utilized to conduct nearly any type of equipment upgrade.
Convoy Key 1
One of two keys needed to open a locked container.
Convoy Key 2
The second of two keys needed to open a locked container.
Perin B3 Gas
A canister of a dangerous chemical nerve agent.
Activate the Brain Scorcher ($$ACTION_USE$$)
Something is holding the switch
Access card required to open door
To Chernobyl NPP (South)
To Chernobyl NPP (North)

north
northwest
west
southwest
south
southeast
Marked One
Loners
Dutiers
Freedomers
Clear Sky members
Ecologists
Mercenaries
Military soldiers
Bandits
Monolith cultists
Zombies
Stalkers
a Loner
a Dutier
a Freedomer
a Clear Sky member
an Ecologist
a Mercenary
a Soldier
a Bandit
a Monolithian
a Zombie
a stalker
